item.name: Battery compartment
item.value: CHECK, BATTERY CONNECTED, LEFT PILOTS BRAKE CYLINDER FOR LEAKAGE AND SECURITY

item.name: Avionics compartment
item.value: CHECK CONDITION AND SECURITY OF ALL ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS
RIGHT PILOTS BRAKE CYLINDERS FOR LEAKAGE AND SECURITY
NOSE WHEEL LOCKING PIN CABLE CONNECTED
NOSE WHEEL MOUNTING BRACKET AND BULKHEAD FOR CRACKS AND DISTORTION

item.name: Engine area
item.value: CHECK FOR FRAYED WIRING, FUEL AND OIL LEAKS, FOREIGN OBJECTS

item.name: Main rotor head, fairing, and control linkage
No. 1 Engine output shaft
item.value: CHECK FOR FREEDOM, THOMAS COUPLING CONDITION

item.name: Droop stop and anti-flap restrainers (as applicable)
Hydraulic sled, manifolds
item.value: CHECK FOR EXTENDED INDICATOR PINS, LEAKS AND CONDITION

item.name: Hoist/Makeup Utility, first and second stage reservoirs and lines
item.value: CHECK OIL LEVEL, LEAKS, CAPS SECURE

item.name: Tail rotor drive shaft and control cables
APP
item.value: OIL LEVEL, FLUID LEAKS, FRAYED WIRING

item.name: Transmission area and control linkage (right side)
No. 2 engine output shaft and torque sensor
Flight controls and aft section of control shroud
Left Side and Under Center Fuselage
Airframe mounted fuel filters (If Installed)
item.value: VISUALLY CHECK FOR SECURITY AND LEAKS

item.name: Aircraft loaded with cargo attached to the hardpoints
item.value: Security of attachment to the hardpoints and to cargo
Security of cable attachment to the cargo

item.name: Aircraft loaded with cargo attached to the single-point hoist
item.value: Cable wound properly on drum; no slack in loops
Hook swivel for operation in both directions
Hook manual release for proper operation
Cable shear charge installed and electrical connections secure

item.name: Cargo Pod Assembly (If Installed)
item.value: The following items must be verified on the airborne workstation:
Visually examine the condition of the cargo pod for evidence of cracks
Visually examine the integrity of the cargo pod attach point
Make sure attaching hardware is secure
Make sure all corner blocks are in contact with the aircraft
Make sure the cargo pod door is latched and secured with fasteners (six total)

item.name: Auxiliary control station compartment
item.value: SECURE, SWITCHES OFF. Switch covers – CLOSED (as applicable)

item.name: Right and left pilot’s gyro selector switches
Overhead control panel switches, and rheostats
Audio Warning system (If Installed)
item.value: Headset - Audible “Test, Test, Engine One Test”
Headset at 59% N1 - Audible “Engine One Failure”
Headset at 0% N1 - Audible “Test, Test, Engine Two Test”
Headset at 59% N1 - Audible “Engine Two Failure”
Headset - Repetitive audible “Engine One Failure, Engine Two Failure”

item.name: Interior lights
item.value: When DC external power is plugged into
voltage and amperage must be observed
at the external power source. External
power advisory light will not illuminate

item.name: Caution-advisory panel
item.value: CHECK (following lights illuminated on DC power, external or battery)
As certain aircraft systems are pressurized and brought
into operation these lights will go out. This assures the
pilot that these caution light circuits are operating.

item.name: The following lights should be illuminated:
item.value: 1ST STAGE SERVO / AFCS SERVO PRESS / 2ND STAGE SERVO
#1 OIL ENG PRESS / #2 ENG OIL PRESS

item.name: Ignition Switch
item.value: (press s and hold until the engine starts)
